post.title: You wake up tomorrow as a homosexual. Do you act on these impulses, and if not, why?

author.bio: Stop reading my bio you pervert.

body: Probably not, because I'm still too introverted and isolated to talk to anyone. I'd also probably assume it's a wild attempt for my brain to escape reality and will wear off soon.
body_html: Probably not, because I'm still too introverted and isolated to talk to anyone. I'd also probably assume it's a wild attempt for my brain to escape reality and will wear off soon.

post.title: You wake up tomorrow as a homosexual. Do you act on these impulses, and if not, why?

body: I would not, because sodomy is shameful and I don't want AIDS. If I couldn't tolerate having sex with a woman, I'd just remain celibate.
body_html: I would not, because sodomy is shameful and I don't want AIDS. If I couldn't tolerate having sex with a woman, I'd just remain celibate.

post.title: You wake up tomorrow as a homosexual. Do you act on these impulses, and if not, why?

author.bio:
Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.
author.bio_html:
Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.

body: It only feels shameful because of our primal urge to procreate as much as possible. In fact being celibate is just as bad from this standpoint, and indeed people who aren't married or who don't pop out kids are often shunned as well, even among religious folks whose morals hold it in high esteem. This point can be dismissed as a dumb instinct. The AIDS however is a real danger and IIRC the *majority* of sexually active gays have some kind of STD.
body_html: It only feels shameful because of our primal urge to procreate as much as possible. In fact being celibate is just as bad from this standpoint, and indeed people who aren't married or who don't pop out kids are often shunned as well, even among religious folks whose morals hold it in high esteem. This point can be dismissed as a dumb instinct. The AIDS however is a real danger and IIRC the majority of sexually active gays have some kind of STD.

post.title: You wake up tomorrow as a homosexual. Do you act on these impulses, and if not, why?

author.bio:
Oliver from Savannah, Georgia, USA.

How I Ruqqus : 
I use news aggregators like popurls.com and upstract.com. Google news with many and large publishers filtered. I save interesting things to the bookmark manager 'raindrop' to share with y'all!
author.bio_html:
Oliver from Savannah, Georgia, USA.

How I Ruqqus : I use news aggregators like popurls.com and upstract.com. Google news with many and large publishers filtered. I save interesting things to the bookmark manager 'raindrop' to share with y'all!

body:
Is there an indicator?  A note or a sign?

Do I suddenly find all men attractive? 

or just one, potential (hypothetical) man?


If I suddenly found all men attractive I think that would make life a lot easier, similar as to if one found all women attractive. It would remove most thought from finding romance.  You could be 100% content with absolutely anyone and find other things to do with your life. 

I scrolled past this post a few times and generated several considerations and thoughts. 

I've read that flamboyant gay men (may) generate those manurisms (subconsciously or otherwise)  to stick out and highlight their gayness as to find and attract mates. So an overnight change probably wouldn't have people waking up with a lisp, flamboyant vocabulary, and overactive limp wrist. 

I'm also aware that the social guilt that other commenters here suggest they feel and which would keep them from becoming actively gay , is in fact felt by many people who do homosexual things, but the urge to have sex overwhelms even that. Which is why people get married and then come out as gay, or gives rationale to post-coitus regret and 'flight'. 

Thinking about it, I'm not sure most people can truly put themselves in the mindset, it seems alien and repugnant when considered hypothetically. I wonder/suspect though if there was a shot or literal method to turn people gay , that people would have a much better ,different, and empathetic / friendly understanding of the position. Though a gay-shot suggests there would be a straight-shot.

 Im curious in this situation if a gay person who would feel that a hypothetical overnight heterosexual change would be similarly alien and repugnant , or if the social guilt they potentially felt, recognized or not, would then become apparent or desirable. 

It makes me think of a comment I read once in regards to being able to choose your sexuality (sexuality being a choice) "who would choose to be gay?"
body_html:
Is there an indicator? A note or a sign?

Do I suddenly find all men attractive?

or just one, potential (hypothetical) man?

If I suddenly found all men attractive I think that would make life a lot easier, similar as to if one found all women attractive. It would remove most thought from finding romance. You could be 100% content with absolutely anyone and find other things to do with your life.

I scrolled past this post a few times and generated several considerations and thoughts.

I've read that flamboyant gay men (may) generate those manurisms (subconsciously or otherwise) to stick out and highlight their gayness as to find and attract mates. So an overnight change probably wouldn't have people waking up with a lisp, flamboyant vocabulary, and overactive limp wrist.

I'm also aware that the social guilt that other commenters here suggest they feel and which would keep them from becoming actively gay , is in fact felt by many people who do homosexual things, but the urge to have sex overwhelms even that. Which is why people get married and then come out as gay, or gives rationale to post-coitus regret and 'flight'.

Thinking about it, I'm not sure most people can truly put themselves in the mindset, it seems alien and repugnant when considered hypothetically. I wonder/suspect though if there was a shot or literal method to turn people gay , that people would have a much better ,different, and empathetic / friendly understanding of the position. Though a gay-shot suggests there would be a straight-shot.

Im curious in this situation if a gay person who would feel that a hypothetical overnight heterosexual change would be similarly alien and repugnant , or if the social guilt they potentially felt, recognized or not, would then become apparent or desirable.

It makes me think of a comment I read once in regards to being able to choose your sexuality (sexuality being a choice) "who would choose to be gay?"
